bio: Cornell University's Baker Program in Real Estate is a comprehensive, specialized, and flexible real estate degree growing leaders in the industry.

posts.description:
Chicago has always pushed the envelope in real estate development. As @archpreissman passes through on his President's Day weekend here are three examples of pushing the built environments limits in Chicago.
The Merchandise Mart opened in 1930, it was the largest building in the world, with 4,000,000 square feet of floor space. The Merchandise Mart is so large that it had its own ZIP code (60654) until 2008. Owned by the Kennedy family for over 50 years.
The Willis Tower is 108-stories, and 1,450-foot. At completion in 1973, it surpassed the World Trade Center towers in New York to become the tallest building in the world, a title it held for nearly 25 years. The Willis Tower is the second-tallest building in the United States.
The Trump International Hotel and Tower, was designed by architect Adrian Smith of Skidmore, Owings and Merrill. Bovis Lend Lease built the 98-story structure, which reaches a height of 1,389 feet.
The Baker Program’s @universityoftexasaustin National Real Estate Case Challenge team enjoying their time in Austin

We have released the full pdf version of the Cornell Real Estate Review for the world to see. Everything from current trends in real estate to future trends are explored in the Review. Thank you @dustincjones @manonsabbatical @matthewrgreen @matthewkfarrell @ershadc @seannmash @ddwright3 @briguy_usa
Our first morning session has started! It's time to not only gain perspective, but to network with those affiliated with the Baker Program in Real Estate!
@cpellz dual @cornellaap and Baker PRE student is taking her Sunday off and enjoying the @ithacabeer. @visitithaca and upstate New York are home to many craft breweries and local wineries.
AREC in Boston, Take 2! Major changes to the Seaport section of Boston to leverage the growing tech demographic.
Check out @christopherdtrahan's blog article Government Officials’ Shortsighted Port Investment Hampers Industrial Market
@cornellmenshockey advances to 7-0, as @noahnububauld puts up a hat trick! Photo taken by the Baker Program's @kabs86 enjoying the 6-1 home team victory at Lynah Rink.
Is PUBLIC Hotel the Answer to Airbnb? By @ershadc currently on the @cornelluniversity Real Estate Blog
Congrats to John Zimmer, '06, co-founder of @lyft, and @cornell_sha grad, on your Innovator Award tonight in NYC. You make us proud.

Happy Fourth of July. I hope everyone enjoys the day off. The United States Declaration of Independence and the United States Constitution were debated and signed at Independence Hall Philadelphia. Independence Hall was completed in 1753 and was designed by Alexander Hamilton and Edmund Woolley.

This week’s Distinguished Speaker is Paul Macpherson Executive Vice President of Global Business & Real Estate Development at Kerzner International. Paul Macpherson is introducing the Baker Program to life in @dubai
Michael Gross @cornelluniversity alumni and Vice Chairman of @wework was the week's Distinguished Speaker. Key take away live your life as an adventure.
Today the Baker Program is visiting the @burjkhalifa

Wilshire Grand stands at 1,100 feet and is the tallest building in Los Angeles, the tallest building in California, and the tallest building west of the Mississippi River. Spire 73, the property’s new 73rd story rooftop bar claims title as the highest open-air bar in the entire Western Hemisphere.
Recent dual degree graduate @matthewrgreen got to catch the @f1 race in @Montreal last weekend. Why bother working hard if you can't play hard!

Celebrating the Birthday of a man who has become synonymous with the institution of Cornell University and its real estate program, The Baker Program in Real Estate! Happy 70th Birthday Michael Tomlan! We appreciate you!

The Pritzker Pavilion at Millennium Park in @chicago was designed by famed architect @frankgehry. While the open concert hall is in Chicago it is a perfect example of the "Santa Monica School" of architecture that @frankgehry developed while in Los Angeles.

@seannmash took this picture using a drone of the solar panels recently installed during an industrial remodel. @seannmash has been active in the implementation of innovative and sustainable real estate solutions read more at http://blog.realestate.cornell.edu/2017/06/20/electric-vehicle-charging-stations-for-retail-centers/
Sharply Dressed, but they've got flare!

Happy Chinese New Year @yang7803 & Chao Ren & Yufei Wang @jkuvijit @jellyj @bankspj! The Rooster is the epitome of fidelity and punctuality. For ancestors who had no alarm clocks, the crowing was significant, as it could awaken people to get up and start to work. In Chinese culture, another symbolic meaning of chicken carries is exorcising evil spirits. @ivyconnect @dustincjones @cornell_sha @cornell_sha_mmh @cornelluniversity @cornellaap @johnsoncornell @cornellpresident @fortecornell

Looking too cool for school @ana_kalugina and @ravi.pammi finished the @univmiami Impact Investment Case Competition and decided to enjoy the warmth and sights of Miami. Congrats to @ana_kalugina Ravikantha Pamidimukkala and Miguel Klipstein on the case!
Baker Program students @cpellz @ana_kalugina and Nick Morris are participating in the

Thank you Richard Baker of @hudsonsbay and @saks for hosting @cornelluniversity during the Titans of Real Estate. It was an amazing event and gave us an incredible insight into the retail sector of real estate.
Dennis Kessler of @urochester spoke this week at the Distinguished Speaker Series about entrepreneurship in the real estate industry and the restaurant world
@ptap1a checked up on the progress of @one_vanderbilt. @one_vanderbilt is set to be completed in 2020 and will reach a height of 1401 feet.
This week’s Distinguished Speaker Series welcomes Kenneth Himmel CEO and President of Related Urban.

Thank you to those serving and all of those who have served in the United States Armed Forces. A very special thanks to Army Captain @scottxguo, a 2017 Baker and @johnsoncornell Alumni and Acquisitions and Leasing Associate at Exeter Property Group
Today is the day. Today is the 35th Annual @cornelluniversity Real Estate Conference at the @thepierreny

Recent grad @cpellz snapped this picture of @aqua_chicago during the @chiarchitecture cruise. @cpellz is a dual graduate of both the @cornellaap and @cornellbakerpre programs and studied the creation of these unique floor plates in Residential Development with Suzanne Charles.

One of the reasons the Baker Program in Real Estate can't be beat, gaining exposure in becoming a total person through the Introduction to Wines Course with Certified Sommelier, Professor Cheryl Stanley. @dustincjones @cornell_sha @johnsoncornell @cornell_sha_mmh @cornellaap @ivyconnect @gradschoolstories

Andrew Benioff of Llenrock Capital and @johnsoncornell alum gives life advice during his Distinguished Speaker Series talk. Let's just say this guy is a, "Deal Guy".
Check out these Baker alumni and all the Cornell alumni in real the estate field at the 35th Annual @cornelluniversity Real Estate Conference on October 13 at the @thepierreny

Everyone thinks their team is the best but we can all agree the @edmontonoilers have the best rink. @rogersplace can hold 18,000 Oilers fans, has a casino, and three residential towers in the development. Epic real estate, Go Oilers!!!
Third year joint @johnsoncornell and Baker Pre masters candidate @ana_kalugina went to Boston over spring break and checked out The Lucas which is converting a Church to high end condos.

@cpellz a dual masters candidate at @cornellaap and The Baker Program at @cornelluniversity was inside 10 @_hudsonyardsnyc developed by @related_group. The view is looking west towards the Hudson River and New Jersey.

Class of 2019 masters candidate @mehanv01 at work on the 60th floor of the Imperial Towers in South Mumbai. The Imperial Towers are the tallest completed buildings in India and they overlook Antilles the most expensive home in the world.

The Flatiron Building, originally the Fuller Building, is a triangular 22-story steel-framed landmarked building located at 175 Fifth Avenue in the borough of Manhattan, New York City, and is considered to be a groundbreaking skyscraper. @curilaura

@archpreissman checks out the "massing models" for what will be the one the largest projects built in Nairobi. Nairobi is currently going through a major real estate boom and Archie is on the ground floor of a major mixed use project in the city core.

The Fair-Haired Dumbbell a 56,000 SF spec office/retail development by @guerrilladev located on the East side of the Burnside Bridge in @portland. The development consists of two six-story buildings that have been hand painted in a psychedelic fashion by renowned LA artist @jamesjeanart. The buildings are connected by sky bridges on each level. $1.5 million of the equity was raised by Portland's own crowdfunding company CrowdStreet, which employs a Baker alum.

Congratulations to Paul Heydweiller, Laura Mattos and Peter Romano on winning the ARGUS University Challenge. This is the second major case competition won by Peter and Paul this week. Keep up the good work.

Prague is filled with unique and interesting buildings. I'm going to venture out and say this might be the most unique. The Zizkov Television Tower now called Tower Park was built in 1985 and reaches a height of 218 meters. And yes naked babies are crawling on it's side.

Cornell real estate case competition recap 2016-2017. 2nd place Argus University Competition, 3rd place MIT Real Estate Case Competition and finalist in the Kellogg Real Estate Venture Competition. The sheer size of @chicago 's Merchandise Mart is simply overwhelming at 4.2 million sf. It was built in 1930 and named the largest building in the world by sf, was owned by the Kennedys for over 50 years, had its own zip code and is still the 44th largest building in the world.

Yesterday, we jointly hosted the 3rd Annual Titans of Real Estate event with the Center for Real Estate & Finance. Our own, Richard Baker ‘88, moderated a panel of distinguished real estate families including the Milstein’s and Rudin’s.
Today marked the completion of Mahanakhon Tower in Bangkok Thailand. The building is 1,030 feet tall at 77 stories and is designed by Ole Schereen.

When a building was built over 800 years ago and it still stands today, it's a well built building. Most buildings built recently won't live to see 100 years Here is Dunamase Castle built in the 12 century in Laios County Ireland which @kpadgham visited before starting her internship.

Baker 1st year students are beginning their transition to becoming "Upperclassmen". Chris Baker, no relation to our namesake, stopped through Charleston, SC to learn more of US History and it's architecture on his way to Miami before spending the summer working in CMBS.

Today was the last review meeting for three of our Cornell Real Estate Review editors @manonsabbatical, @matthewrgreen and Harrison Willis. All three of them have been instrumental in building the Cornell Real Estate Review. We appreciate all of their efforts and contributions to the program.

Be a part of the @cornelluniversity university Baker program Super Day. Follow the link in bio or email real_estate@cornell.edu to learn more.
The 35th Annual @cornelluniversity Real Estate Conference is right around the corner. The conference is October 13th and will take place at @thepierreny the link to buy tickets is in on our profile.
Traditional Korean Dinner with The Family after viewing awesome buildings, and seeing how Korea seamlessly sews the future in with the past. @ivyconnect @cornell_sha @cornellaap @cornelluniversity
Classes are done and internships are secured. Time to enjoy slope day and start studying for finals.

@alejandros88 is in London for his summer internship and was checking out the @shardview. The Shard London Bridge is the tallest building in the United Kingdom at 1,016 feet tall and designed by @rpbw_architects.
Our very own Beth VanDine

@archpreissman just got back back from his internship in Kenya and did the @chiarchitecture River cruise. @vistatowerchicago is currently under construction and when completed it will be 1,186 feet, the third tallest building in Chicago. It was designed by @studiogang and developed by @magellan_development

Congratulations to our team from @cornelluniversity for making the finals of the @urbanlandinstitute @hines Student Competition. The Cornell University team is anchored with three Baker students and two students from @cornellaap. Together the team beat out 130 teams to make the final four and will present in the finals in @uli_toronto April 5th.

During his winter break @archpreissman visited the newest @apple flagship store in @chicago. @fosterandpartners designed the store and the space will be one of the key drivers to the Chicago River front.

Congrats to The Cornell Baker Team in placing 2nd in the National Argus University Case Competition. Argus Enterprise is financial modeling software used to project future cash flows in real estate. Congrats to Paul Heydweiller, @yang7803 @y.julin @alejandros88 @yufeigeng
Cornell's first potential Real Estate PhD. candidateDaniel "Dad'iel" Wright celebrates his birthday with books, tabasco and chocolate cake from @curilaura & @raulianst
@jiminwon discusses the impact of the massive redevelopment of Treasure Island in the San Francisco Bay. Link in bio.

Congratulations to Miguel Klipstein, Mark Hughes and Alejandro Garza on finishing second place in the Impact Investing in Commercial Real Estate Competition hosted by The University of Miami. The Cornell University team proposed a retail-entertainment development for the eastern end of a former concrete roadway on the Rickenbacker Causeway.

Chao Rhen class of 2018 took the weekend to do a little architectural tour of the US. Chao has a unique background as he is a certified architect in China and Japan. He snapped this one down in Pennsylvania of Falling Water by @franklloydwrightofficial.
First year student and Rochester native @matthewtkenny discusses past and present developments in Rochester with @ershadc in front of the Eastman Kodak HQ.
1st Year and potential PhD Student gets his first taste teaching class for @dustincjones. His classmates said he is ready to be a great lecturer.
Cornell University Real Estate Blog’s newest article Dollar Stores: Finding a Multi-billion Dollar Niche by Jimin Won
Daniel A. D’Aniello Co-Founder and Chairman Emeritus of The Carlyle Group spoke to @cornelluniversity during the 30th Annual Lewis H. Durland Memorial Lecture
@archpreissman is on site at the Alma with @cytonn. The Alma is a 450 unit condo and retail project currently being built by Cytonn in Nairobi Kenya.
@raulianst attended The Indonesia Hospitality Highlight 2017 at Jakarta Convention Center to discuss how technology is changing the growing hospitality sector in Indonesia
Baker/CRP @cpellz participates as a lawyer during the construction management arbitration for Dr. Carr's Civil Engineering/Construction class.

When you decide to move to Ithaca from as far away as the other side of the globe, the internal support system provided by Our Mom at our home away from home is crucial. We appreciate you Kathy more than you could ever imagine! Thank you for all you do behind the scenes to keep this engine running fluidly.

The 35th Annual @cornelluniversity Real Estate Conference is right around the corner and check out The rise of Brooklyn as a hotbed for TAMI (technology, advertising, media and information) by Tiya Jain in the Cornell Real Estate Blog.

Over the weekend @wilshiregrand opened to the public. The tower is 1,100 feet tall making fit the tallest building west of the Mississippi, and will include 67,000 sf of retail, 677,000 sf of office and a 900 room @intercontinental hotel.
